comments:
Crash when I create a simple Hello world application with C Managed Build.

I do this from a clean installation of Eclispe SDK 3.1.2 and CDT 3.0.2.

Launching for normal execution results in crash. I run eclipse with j2sdk1.4.2 and
vmargs -Xmx512M -Xms256M.

The crash happens most of the times I try this, but sometimes execution is successful and sometimes there is an X error:

XIO:  fatal IO error 9 (Bad file number) on X server ":0.0"

Java trace back printed by eclipse:

Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
No more handles
Error while informing user about event loop exception:

Do you have other plugins installed in your workspace? "No more handles" means that Eclipse leeaks images or other resources.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Do you have other plugins installed in your workspace? "No more handles" means
> that Eclipse leeaks images or other resources.
> 

No more plugins. Made a new installation of eclipse SDK and CDT.
Normally I get the XIO fault the first time I run, and then the crash the next time. Sometimes I can do 'run' several times before it crashes.

Maybe I should mention that this is on Solaris9 and Motif.

Erik,
Unfortunatly I can't try it - I don't have Solaris box, niether I a Motif expert. 
There is a SWT tool (Sleak, see http://www.eclipse.org/swt/tools.php) that may be helpful. You can track what is leaking using it.

Are you still seeing this problem?  This use-case works for me.

This is definitely an environment problem, so I will close this bug.  If you have additional info, or want additional help diagnosing the problem, feel free to re-open this defect.
